topics.title: Zer0Net and Personal Security
topics.body: Hell0 everyone, recently I have noticed some questions regarding the possibility of hosting malicious content, I know that nofish had answered to FreeBSD's question @ zeronet.readthedocs.org, someone else on another forum had made the same question (either copy/paste or the same guy), I was wondering if there is any documentation , or if there are plans to make something to highlighting this matter.

20@2.body:
Benchmarking ZeroNet 0.3.1 (rev247) Python 2.7.9 (default, Dec 10 2014, 12:24:55) [MSC v.1500 32 bit (Intel)], platform: win32...

CryptBitcoin:
- hdPrivatekey x 10..........0.224s [x3.13: WOW]
- sign x 10..........0.115s [x3.04: WOW]
- openssl verify x 100..........0.144s [x2.57: WOW]
- pure-python verify x 10..........0.641s [x2.50: Fast]

CryptHash:
- sha512 x 10 000..........0.459s [x2.18: Fast]

Db:
- Open x 10..........0.015s [x8.67: Insane!!]
- Insert x 10 x 1000..........0.358s [x2.79: WOW]
- Buffered insert x 100 x 100..........0.600s [x2.17: Fast]
- Total rows in db: 20000
- Indexed query x 1000..........0.124s [x2.02: Fast]
- Not indexed query x 100..........0.294s [x2.04: Fast]
- Like query x 100..........0.883s [x2.04: Fast]

Done. Total: 3.99s

1@221.body: same here, see the circle with a line underneath it.
